00103 class SIM_API cLogLevel
00104 {
00105   public:
00111     static LogLevel globalRuntimeLoglevel;
00112

00117

00129 #ifndef GLOBAL_COMPILETIME_LOGLEVEL
00130 #ifdef NDEBUG
00131 #define GLOBAL_COMPILETIME_LOGLEVEL LOGLEVEL_INFO
00132 #else
00133 #define GLOBAL_COMPILETIME_LOGLEVEL LOGLEVEL_TRACE
00134 #endif
00135 #endif

00138 // Creates a log proxy object that captures the provided context.
00139 // This macro is internal to the logging infrastructure.
00140 //
00141 // NOTE: the (void)0 trick prevents GCC producing statement has no effect warnings
00142 // for compile time disabled log statements.
00143 //
00144 #define OPP_LOGPROXY(object, classname, loglevel, category) \
00145         ((void)0, !(loglevel <= GLOBAL_COMPILETIME_LOGLEVEL && \
00146          !ev.isDisabled() && \
00147          loglevel <= cLogLevel::globalRuntimeLoglevel && \
00148          cLogProxy::isEnabled(object, category, loglevel))) ? \
00149          cLogProxy::dummyStream : cLogProxy(object, category, loglevel, __FILE__, __LINE__, classname, __FUNCTION__)
00150 
00151 
00152 // Returns NULL. Helper function for the logging macros.
00153 inline void *getThisPtr() {return NULL;}
00154 
00155 // Returns NULL. Helper function for the logging macros.
00156 inline const char *getClassName() {return NULL;}
00157 
00170 #define EV_STATICCONTEXT  void *(*getThisPtr)() = ::getThisPtr; const char *(*getClassName)() = ::getClassName;
00171 
00182 #define OPP_LOG(loglevel, category) OPP_LOGPROXY(getThisPtr(), getClassName(), loglevel, category).getStream()
00183 
00194 #define EV        EV_INFO                        ///< Short for EV_INFO
00195 #define EV_FATAL  OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_FATAL, NULL)  ///< Log local fatal errors
00196 #define EV_ERROR  OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_ERROR, NULL)  ///< Log local but recoverable errors
00197 #define EV_WARN   OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_WARN, NULL)   ///< Log warnings
00198 #define EV_INFO   OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_INFO, NULL)   ///< Log information (default log level)
00199 #define EV_DETAIL OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_DETAIL, NULL) ///< Log state variables and other low-level information
00200 #define EV_DEBUG  OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_DEBUG, NULL)  ///< Log state variables and other low-level information
00201 #define EV_TRACE  OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_TRACE, NULL)  ///< Log control flow information (entering/exiting functions, etc)
00202 
00203 
00214 #define EV_C(category)        EV_INFO_C(category)                ///< Short for EV_INFO_C
00215 #define EV_FATAL_C(category)  OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_FATAL, category)  ///< Log local fatal errors
00216 #define EV_ERROR_C(category)  OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_ERROR, category)  ///< Log local but recoverable errors
00217 #define EV_WARN_C(category)   OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_WARN, category)   ///< Log warnings
00218 #define EV_INFO_C(category)   OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_INFO, category)   ///< Log information (default log level)
00219 #define EV_DETAIL_C(category) OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_DETAIL, category) ///< Log state variables and other low-level information
00220 #define EV_DEBUG_C(category)  OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_DEBUG, category)  ///< Log state variables and other low-level information
00221 #define EV_TRACE_C(category)  OPP_LOG(LOGLEVEL_TRACE, category)  ///< Log control flow information (entering/exiting functions, etc)

00229 class SIM_API cLogEntry
00230 {
00231   public:
00232     // log statement related
00233     LogLevel loglevel;
00234     const char *category;
00235 
00236     // C++ source related (where the log statement appears)
00237     const void *sourcePointer;
00238     const cObject *sourceObject;
00239     const cComponent *sourceComponent;
00240     const char *sourceFile;
00241     int sourceLine;
00242     const char *sourceClass;
00243     const char *sourceFunction;
00244 
00245     // operating system related
00246     clock_t userTime;
00247 
00248     // the actual text of the log statement
00249     const char *text;
00250     int textLength;
00251 };

00260 class SIM_API cLogProxy
00261 {
00262   private:
00267     class LogBuffer : public std::basic_stringbuf<char> {
00268       public:
00269         LogBuffer() { }
00270         bool isEmpty() { return pptr() == pbase(); }
00271       protected:
00272         virtual int sync();  // invokes ev.log() for each log line
00273     };
00274 
00275     // act likes /dev/null
00276     class nullstream : public std::ostream {
00277       public:
00278         nullstream() : std::ostream(0) {}  // results in rdbuf==0 and badbit==true
00279     };
00280 
00281   public:
00282     static nullstream dummyStream; // EV evaluates to this when in express mode (ev.disabled())
00283 
00284   private:
00285     static LogBuffer buffer;  // underlying buffer that contains the text that has been written so far
00286     static std::ostream globalStream;  // this singleton is used to avoid allocating a new stream each time a log statement executes
00287     static cLogEntry currentEntry; // context of the current (last) log statement that has been executed.
00288     static LogLevel previousLoglevel; // log level of the previous log statement
00289     static const char *previousCategory; // category of the previous log statement
00290 
00291   public:
00292     cLogProxy(const void *sourcePointer, const char *category, LogLevel loglevel, const char *sourceFile, int sourceLine, const char *sourceClass, const char *sourceFunction);
00293     cLogProxy(const cObject *sourceObject, const char *category, LogLevel loglevel, const char *sourceFile, int sourceLine, const char *sourceClass, const char *sourceFunction);
00294     cLogProxy(const cComponent *sourceComponent, const char *category, LogLevel loglevel, const char *sourceFile, int sourceLine, const char *sourceClass, const char *sourceFunction);
00295     ~cLogProxy();
00296 
00297     static bool isEnabled(const void *sourceObject, const char *category, LogLevel loglevel);
00298     static bool isEnabled(const cComponent *sourceComponent, const char *category, LogLevel loglevel);
00299     static bool isComponentEnabled(const cComponent *component, const char *category, LogLevel loglevel);
00300 
00301     std::ostream& getStream() { return globalStream; }
00302     static void flushLastLine();
00303 
00304   protected:
00305     void fillEntry(const char *category, LogLevel loglevel, const char *sourceFile, int sourceLine, const char *sourceClass, const char *sourceFunction);
00306 };
00307 
00308 #endif
